page.description: Get the index of a Column from the name.
page.original:
SQL::TableInfo::ColumnNumber() Syntax Column_Number as N = .ColumnNumber( Name as C ) ArgumentDescription Column_NumberThe number of the column named. -1 if the column name is not in the column list. A SQL::TableInfo object. NameColumn (field) name.
Description The ColumnNumber() method gets the subscript index of the requested column name in the Column array property. Examples dim TableInfo as SQL::TableInfo dim ColumnIndex as N Connection.GetTableInfo(TableInfo, "customers") ColumnIndex = TableInfo.ColumnNumber("customerid") if (ColumnIndex > 0) then Names = Names + TableInfo.Column[ColumnIndex].Name + crlf() end if
See Also SQL::TableInfo Object Limitations
